Also would love to see a freezer 101 type video, everything that can go in it and tips on storage and cleaning for it also.

Hi! I am majoring in foods and nutrition and I want to help you! It's so important that one sees a registered dietitian if one is trying to stop eating meat. This is only because registered dietitians are the most qualified about food and nutrition, more qualified than doctors. Meat products provide more for our body than protein; they provide micronutrients that are crucial for our health. Unfortunately, deficiencies in micronutrients can take decades to become apparent and by the time one is diagnosed, it can be too late. Supplements are definitely not a good way to get nutrients because supplement companies aren't well regulated by the government. For example, there are 8 chemical versions of vitamin E but supplement manufacturers can only provide 5 out of the 8 chemical versions of vitamin E and label it as a "vitamin E" supplement. So it's important to get nutrition from food.
So that's why if you want to stop eating meat think about getting a meal plan from an R.D.
They will help you with recipes and everything you want to know :) Hope that helps. Sending love.
(I just started my YoutTube page. I am focusing on foods and nutrition as one of my main topics because it is what I am studying)

Thank you for the feedback - I will definitely keep those video ideas in mind😊Yes! Buying from your local farmers is another great way to save money. Its really not hard to make almond milk, i make it every two weeks, way cheaper and healthier

@Jena Blochwitz I don't strain my hemp milk if I'm using it for smoothies with a stronger flavour profile. If I'm making chocolate hemp milk for drinking, let's say, I do strain it for a better mouth feel... and to tone down that slightly "grassy" taste you get from whole hemp hearts. Metal mesh strainer works well. Didn't bother with nut milk bag or even cheesecloth. I guess lining the strainer with a basket-type paper coffee filter would do an even better job, if you wanted the smoothest milk texture... That link I posted -- she also has recipes for most alternative milks (non-dairy). Let me know how it goes! 🙂
Joanne Iskander thanks!! Do you strain yours?

I used to make my own almond milk for smoothies (and no, not difficult, but a bit time consuming) until I discovered a no fuss, simple recipe for hemp milk. No need to soak -- or even strain it, depending on your personal preference. Serious game changer on those rushed mornings... Really love the chocolate version too! https://www.theblendergirl.com/recipe/hemp-milk/
Jena Blochwitz portion out how many almonds. Get raw. Wash. Soak in warm water for a few minutes. Wash. Blend w water n vanilla. Done.
